meanings.definition: (political campaign) A race between candidates who want to be elected to a political office; (general): a set of actions that are planned and carried out to make something happen.
examples: Political campaigns for U.S. President can start organizing two years before anyone casts a vote.

images.alt: Photo of election signs on a roadside.
images.description: At the center of the photo is a grassy area, with a sidewalk to its left and a road to its right. Placed on the grassy area is a series of signs which read, from front to back, "Carol Roe for City Council," "Arts & Culture Works! Vote Yes 8," "Vote November 3rd," "Kahlil Seren City Council," "Nadas for City Council." Nine more signs, illegible, extend into the background of the photo.
images.caption: Political campaigns post signs to encourage people to vote.

meanings.definition: An important topic that people disagree on and are talking about.
examples: Andre believed that a lot of issues could be settled by people talking and listening to each other.

images.alt: Photo of trash on a beach.
images.description: A sandy beach with plastic bottles, straws, bottle caps, buckets, styrofoam, and other trash and rocks and sticks on it. Boats float on water in the background.
images.caption: Pollution is a key issue that needs to be solved.

source.title: Garbage on Pantai Pangalisang, Pulau Bunaken, Sulawesi
source.author: travelourplanet.com

meanings.definition: A person being considered for a certain position.
examples: Each candidate believes that they are the best person for the job.

images.alt: Photo of two people smiling and waving.
images.description: Photo of a man and a woman smiling and waving, with American flag in the background.
images.caption: Walter Mondale and Geraldine Ferraro ran for U.S. President and Vice President in 1980.

source.title: Candidates Walter Mondale and Geraldine Ferraro campaigning at Ft. Lauderdale
source.author: Warren K. Leffler

meanings.definition: to show so that others will see or know about.
examples: My school displayed the American flag in every classroom.

images.alt: Photo showing front pages of newspaper.
images.description: Three issues of a newspaper titled "The Whetsone" are shown in this photo. The headline of the newspaper in the foreground reads, "President Under Fire." The headline of the paper in the mid-ground is "March of the Woverines." The headline of the paper in the background is, "Downtown Revival."
images.caption: Newspapers publish information in paper and online.

meanings.definition: A set of beliefs about what is right and wrong.
examples: Our class debated the ethics of using animals to test if drugs are safe for humans.

meanings.definition: Unhappy because what was hoped or wished for did not happen.
examples: The children were disappointed when they did not get the toys they wanted.

images.alt: Painting of a person with a sad expression on her face.
images.description: Painting shows a woman sitting in a broken chair. The woman leans slightly forward, her head tilted slightly down. One of her arms is bent, with her hand on her cheek and her elbow on her leg. She looks up and to the left with a sad expression on her face.
images.caption: Sometimes you can see disappointment in someone's expression.

examples: Anna was dismayed when what she said was deliberately misunderstood and used against her.

images.alt: Photo of a man with head down.
images.description: This photo shows a man walking on a grass field. His head is tilted down and his left arm is bending, with his hand is touching is forehead. He has a frowining expression. The man's right arm is held across his body, with his right hand at his left elbow.
images.caption: A man dismayed at a sports field.

meanings.definition: To keep out from a group.
examples: It is not nice to exclude one person from a group conversation.

images.alt: Photo of bench and sign: "For Colored Patrons Only"
images.description: This photo shows a wooden bench. At the top of the back of the bench is a sign which reads, "For Colored Patrons Only."
images.caption: During segregation, Black Americans were excluded from comfortable sitting areas and were forced to use these uncomfortable benches.

source.title: New Orleans Public Service Streetcar Bench with Colored Segregation Sign
source.author: Infrogmation of New Orleans

meanings.definition: To keep out from a group.
examples: Though falsely accused, Bill knew his community would ostracize him so he moved to another town.

images.alt: Photo of bench and sign: "For Colored Patrons Only"
images.description: This photo shows a wooden bench. At the top of the back of the bench is a sign which reads, "For Colored Patrons Only."
images.caption: During segregation, black Americans were ostracized and not allowed to interact with white Americans in public places.

source.title: New Orleans Public Service Streetcar Bench with Colored Segregation Sign
source.author: Infrogmation of New Orleans

meanings.definition: very important; something that decides success or failure.
examples: Today, social media is pivotal to creating a successful campaign.

images.alt: Photo of goalie stopping a ball from entering the net.
images.description: Photo shows a person extended horizontally in front of a large net. The person's legs are off the ground on the right side of the photo. His arms are extended toward the left side, with his left arm reaching out toward a soccer ball.
images.caption: Preventing the other team from scoring is pivotal to winning a soccer game.

source.title: Soccer goalkeeper
source.author: Master Sgt. Lance Cheung of U.S. Air Force

examples: Cora and her brother often argued because their political positions were so different.

meanings.definition: Very important; something that decides success or failure.
examples: During hot summer months, it is crucial for people to drink lots of water.

meanings.definition: Troubled or attacked; disturbed in an unwanted way.
examples: When the tourists invaded, the extra people and traffic made the town very crowded and noisy.
Many people agree with the governorâ€™s stances on energy and the environment.

meanings.definition: To attack with energy or violence.
examples: The lies and rumors assailed the candidate's reputation.
